title: Strictly's star begs fans to stop sending Shirley Ballas death threats
text:
He wants fans to stop(Picture: WENN)

Strictly Come Dancing star AJ Pritchard has begged fans to stop sending Shirley Ballas death threats after the judge has fallen ill.

The Head Judge has come under attack from some Strictly viewers after last week’s shock dance-off, which saw BBC Radio One DJ Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell sent home.

Professional dancer AJ Pritchard has also waded in and said fans need to focus on positivity and that ‘there’s no need for death threats’.

Speaking to The Sun Online at The Global Gift Gala he said: ‘There is no excuse for the trolling and death threats. All the abuse they have been getting is not right.

‘People should just enjoy the show, it’s a great family show and focus on positivity.’

Addressing Dev’s shock exit, he added: ‘You do become very close. You train together all the time and the friendship just grows.

Aj Pritchard is pleading with viewers to stop sending Shirley death threats (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC/BBC/PA Wire)

‘I was shocked. Someone who was such a natural dancer has gone.

‘It just shows that nobody is safe. The pressure is on now. We have to appreciate every week we are still there.’

Shirley, 59, shared pictures of herself hooked up to a drip after falling ill ahead of the fifth week of Strictly.

Shirley seems to be on the mend (Picture: Shirley Ballas/Instagram)

Hopefully, Shirley will be better for Saturday’s show (Picture: Shirley Ballas/Instagram)

The judge was meant to attend the Global Gift Gala, but instead spent her evening hooked up to an intravenous drip in the hopes of perking up by Saturday.

She told her fans: ‘Good morning everybody, afternoon. I’m just about to have this intravenous drip and this young lady is going to tell you why.’

Katrina from Reviv explained the drip was a ‘recovery infusion that’s great if you’re feeling sick, hungover, jet-lagged or just under the weather. It’s pumped with B12, it has an anti-inflammatory medication, vitamin C, magnesium and all the stuff that’ll make Shirley feel better – especially during this awful weather.’

Shirley added on her Instagram story: ‘Hopefully we’ll be right as rain by Saturday.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.
